item.title: One Of 2024's Best Shooters Is Now On PS5 And Xbox Series X|S
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Strange Scaffold's I Am Your Beast was one of GameSpot's picks for the best PC-exclusive games of 2024. In the developer's follow-up to El Paso, Elsewhere, PC players stepped into the role of former secret agent Alphonse Harding. Now, PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S owners are getting their chance to play I Am Your Beast.

On June 25, I Am Your Beast will officially go live on PSN and Xbox Live. In the game’s story, Harding has left his life of espionage and action behind him, even when his former employers at the Covert Operations Initiative try to entice him back for one final mission. When Harding turns down COI, it responds by sending countless agents to put him in an early grave. As you might expect, Harding takes that personally, and he's the wrong guy to mess with.

The newly released ports include I Am Your Beast's free expansion, which was released last November. Nine new levels were added to the game, as well as an epilogue that gave players even more ridiculously over-the-top action. The epilogue is taken from the accounts of the few COI agents who managed to survive Harding's wrath, and in their retelling he has superhuman abilities that break the laws of reason and physics.

I Am Your Beast was ported to iOS earlier this year without the added features that were included in the expansion. However, the mobile version of the game is also receiving a major update that will make it "feature-complete" with all of the material included with its PC and console ports. But on any platform, it's one of the best shooters to play in 2025.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Sony Re-Confirms That It Won't Put Its New Games On PS Plus At Launch Like Xbox Does
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Microsoft releases its own first-party Xbox games on Game Pass at launch, but Sony does not do this--and it's not planning to change that strategy going forward.

PlayStation services executive Nick Maguire told Game File that Sony has "stayed true to our strategy across the board," and that means no day-one new releases on PS Plus. "We're not looking to put games in day and date," Maguire said.

Back in 2022, PlayStation boss Jim Ryan--who has since left the company--said the "virtuous cycle" of Sony's business plans for gaming would be "broken" if Sony launched its new games into PS Plus.

"The level of investment that we need to make in our studios would not be possible, and we think the knock-on effect on the quality of the games that we make would not be something that gamers want."

The cycle, as Ryan described it is that, "the investment delivers success, which enables yet more investment, which delivers yet more success."

However, Ryan also acknowledged at the time that Sony wasn't married to this idea and would be open to changing its stance based on market conditions. In the three years since Ryan said this, however, Sony has not changed its stance, and the new comments from Maguire make it sound like it's not changing soon.

Also in the Game File interview, Maguire was asked if Sony's ill-fated live-service shooter Concord may have fared better had it been released on PS Plus at launch. Maguire declined to comment on that game specifically, but he said PS Plus has "proven itself to be a great way to introduce new players to franchises."

Maguire said the calculus comes down to finding the "right time" for a game to enter PS Plus to help it reach a wider audience after its initial debut. This could help a game "find new fans" or reach "new parts of our platform that it hasn't already reached," he said.

While Sony doesn't plan to launch its own games into PS Plus day-and-date, the company is partnering with third-party studios to debut new titles into the subscription service. FBC: Firebreak was a recent example of this. Going forward, Maguire said Sony aims to find four or five games each year to launch into PS Plus day-and-date, with Sony's own games coming to the service after a year, 18 months, or longer.

"That balance for us is working really well across the platform," Maguire said, adding that the four-to-five day-one third-party games each year is not a strict number but a ballpark estimate.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sony-re-confirms-that-it-wont-put-its-new-games-on-ps-plus-at-launch-like-xbox-does/1100-6532705/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Hellblade 2 Lands On PS5 In August With An Enhanced Edition
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2 will officially arrive on PS5 on August 12 as part of an Enhanced edition release. This new version of the game will also be available as a free update for Xbox Series X|S and PC versions, and it includes various graphical and gameplay additions, an enhanced photo mode, and developer commentary.

Microsoft says that the Enhanced Edition includes a performance mode that targets a frame rate of 60fps, and on PC specifically, users can push the game's graphics with a "Very High" preset. The game will also be Steam Deck Verified once the Enhanced Edition launches.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II Playstation 5 Official Trailer

PS5 owners looking to experience the full story can grab a deluxe edition of Hellblade 2 for $70, which includes Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice optimized for the console and its original soundtrack. If you already own the PS4 version, you can upgrade to the PS5 edition for free.

For the new features, players can once again take on the malicious Dark Rot in an additional challenge mode, and in the upgraded photo mode, several improvements have been made and an all-new "Motion" tab for custom cinematic video capture has been added.

The commentary tracks from the developers also sound interesting, as there's over four hours of audio from the game's cast, the Ninja Theory team, and people who helped the team to respectfully convey Senua's experience of psychosis. It's not known if studio founder Tameem Antoniades is included, as he is no longer with the company.

Microsoft has had many successful releases on PS5 lately, as several of the best-selling games for April 2025 on PlayStation in the US were all published by the company. Forza Horizon 5 and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle have been big winners on Sony's platform, and Hellblade 2 won't be the only game arriving in August.

It'll be joined by Gears of War Reloaded--which launches on August 26--and the game will support cross-play and cross-progression on all platforms that it launches for.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Death Stranding 2 Was Made In Partnership With A Nintendo-Owned Studio
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The CG animation and motion capture company Nintendo Pictures, formerly known as Dynamo Pictures, has been revealed to have worked on Sony's Death Stranding 2: On the Beach.

VGC spotted the company's name in the Death Stranding 2 credits. While it might seem surprising to see a Nintendo-owned company work on a PlayStation game, it's not totally unexpected. Prior to Nintendo's acquisition of Dynamo in 2022 and re-branding to Nintendo Pictures, the company worked on the original Death Stranding.

Since 2022, Nintendo Pictures' work on game projects has focused on Nintendo games, including Super Mario Bros. Wonder and The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom. But it's possible the work Nintendo Pictures did on Death Stranding 2 was done prior to Nintendo's buyout, or that a previous contract was in place to allow the company to work on Death Stranding 2 even as a company owned by Nintendo.

Another theory is that Nintendo Pictures' work beyond games is allowed to go forward for animation projects. After all, Nintendo Pictures did work for the Pretty Cure anime from Toei Animation following Nintendo's buyout of the company.

In any event, this isn't the first time Sony and Nintendo will work together, as the two companies are partnered up for the live-action The Legend of Zelda movie. Sony Pictures and Nintendo are co-financing the movie, which was recently delayed a bit.

As for Death Stranding 2, it's available now for people who pay more, while the standard edition unlocks on June 26. GameSpot's Death Stranding 2 review scored the game a 7/10. Reviewer Diego Nicolás Argüello wrote, "Death Stranding 2: On The Beach is fixated on revisiting past ideas, which limits its impact to being a good but not great sequel."

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/death-stranding-2-was-made-in-partnership-with-a-nintendo-owned-studio/1100-6532704/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Kindle Fire HD 8 Plus Tablet Is Over 50% Off Ahead Of Prime Day 2025
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Prime Day is quickly approaching, but if you’re in the market for an affordable tablet, there’s no need to wait until July 8. Amazon is currently dropping the price of its Amazon Fire HD 8 Plus (32GB) to just $55 (was $120)--bringing it to the lowest price we’ve ever seen. There’s also an excellent deal for the 64GB model, and you can snag a preowned Amazon Fire HD 10 for just $70 (was $120). All three are limited-time deals, though it’s unclear when they’ll disappear.

2022 Amazon Fire HD 8 Plus

32GB: $55 (was $120) | 64GB: $85 (was $150)

While these aren’t the latest models of the tablet, they’re still powerful enough for all your daily computing needs, such as browsing the web or streaming TV shows. Equipped with 3GB RAM, a 2MP front-facing camera, a 5MP rear-facing camera, up to 13 hours of battery life, and a durable 8-inch HD display, it’s a pretty great value at just $55.

If you’re worried about storage space, the 64GB version is on sale for $85. However, both tablets feature a microSD card slot, allowing you to add up to 1 TB of additional storage space.

Available apps include Netflix, Prime Video, Disney+, and Showtime. Google Play is not supported, but you’ll find most of the big apps and games compatible with the Fire HD 8 Plus, so give it a look if you need an affordable tablet that can handle all the basics. Note that this version of the tablet features an ad-supported lockscreen.

For comparison, the newest Amazon Fire HD 8 starts at $100.

Amazon Fire HD 10 (Preowned)

$70 (was $120)

Want something with a larger display? A preowned, like-new version of the Fire HD 10 is on sale for $70 (was $120). Along with a 10.1-inch 1080p screen, it gets you a 5MP rear-facing camera, a 5MP front-facing camera, a microSD card slot, 3GB RAM, and the same 13-hour battery life of the Fire HD 8 Plus. It also features an ad-supported lock screen.

Although it’s preowned, Amazon tests each device to ensure its functionality and quality. Amazon's refurbishment process includes secure data wipes and replacement of faulty hardware, so it should feel like a brand-new tablet.

These tablets aren’t the only great Amazon products on sale ahead of Prime Day. A long list of Amazon Fire 4K TVs and soundbars are seeing nice discounts right now--giving you a cheap way to upgrade your home theater. There’s also a fantastic limited-time deal on the Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K, as it’s just $25 (was $50). For more great deals, swing by our Prime Day Hub--and be sure to sign up for Prime so you can cash in on all the offers when Prime Day begins on July 8.

item.title: Reserve Samsung Fold Ultra To Get $50 Off And Enter A Sweepstakes
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The next Samsung Galaxy Unpacked event takes place on July 9, and the company is ready to show off its latest lineup of foldable smartphones. It’s unclear exactly what will be revealed at Unpacked, though there’s a strong possibility we’ll see successors to the Galaxy Z Fold 6 and Galaxy Z Flip 6. We’ll also likely hear more about Galaxy AI and its implementation in the new devices. While there’s a lot we don’t know, we do know that you’ll receive $50 in Samsung Credit when you reserve the device. You’ll also get up to $1,150 in additional savings--plus a ticket in a sweepstakes with a grand prize of $5,000 Samsung Credits.

If you think you’ll be grabbing a new device later this year, reserving a unit and entering the sweepstakes is easy. Just head over to Samsung’s official website, enter your name, email, and check the box asking if you’d like to enter the sweepstakes. You can also enter your phone number (though it’s entirely optional). You’ll then have to confirm your age and state of residence before officially confirming your reservation. Note that you won’t have to put any money down, and you’re not obligated to purchase anything after placing a reservation. However, you won’t get your $50 in Samsung Credits unless you finalize your preorder following the reveal.

Samsung has been teasing several aspects of its upcoming lineup, suggesting it’ll offer new AI tools, an improved camera, a slimmer profile, and provide users with an “Ultra-experience.” Based on the livestream's "Ultra Unfolds" title, it's fair to assume that it’ll be a new foldable Ultra phone. The official reveal will take place on July 9 at 10:00 AM ET.

Considering the new smartphone is likely to be quite expensive (as are all foldables), the extra $50 for reserving it could help you pick up accessories like a new case or earbuds. The reveal also happens to take place during Prime Day--so consider shopping around at the online retailer to see if any discounted accessories would be a nice companion for the upcoming smartphone. The retailer happens to have several Early Prime Day Deals on 4K TVs, soundbars, SSDs, and more you can take advantage of before Amazon's big sale kicks off next month.
